summary: Cover letter from defense attorney Christian Everdell to Judge Nathan submitting a renewed bail motion and accompanying exhibits under seal in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter indicates the documents are being sent in successive emails due to volume.

Everdell is formally submitting legal documents to Judge Nathan, the presiding judge in the case.

events.title: Submission of Renewed Bail Motion
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell submits a renewed bail motion and accompanying exhibits under seal to Judge Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: A renewed bail motion was filed under seal for Ghislaine Maxwell on December 8, 2020.
The motion was submitted by defense attorney Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP to Judge Nathan.
The submission included a cover letter, the unredacted motion, and five unredacted exhibits (A-E).
The documents were sent in successive emails due to their volume.
The correspondence is marked confidential and privileged, indicating sensitive content within the bail application.
